title: Credit Score Risk Classification
description: Defines risk levels based on applicant credit score ranges
content:
Credit Score Risk Classification Policy

This policy defines risk levels based on applicant credit score ranges for mortgage loan applications.

Risk Classification Rules:

1. Credit Score 750 or higher: LOW RISK - Action: APPROVE
   Excellent credit. Standard processing. No additional documentation required.

2. Credit Score 700-749: LOW RISK - Action: APPROVE
   Good credit. Standard processing with routine verification.

3. Credit Score 650-699: MEDIUM RISK - Action: REVIEW
   Fair credit. Requires senior underwriter review. May require additional income verification.

4. Credit Score 580-649: HIGH RISK - Action: ESCALATE
   Below average credit. Requires credit committee approval. Consider higher interest rate or larger down payment.

5. Credit Score below 580: CRITICAL RISK - Action: DENY
   Poor credit. Application should be declined unless exceptional compensating factors exist.

Regulatory Reference: CFPB Fair Lending Guidelines
Effective Date: January 1, 2025

title: Debt-to-Income Ratio Requirements
description: Establishes acceptable DTI thresholds for loan approval
content:
Debt-to-Income Ratio Requirements Policy

This policy establishes acceptable DTI thresholds for mortgage loan approval. DTI is calculated as Total Monthly Debt Payments divided by Gross Monthly Income multiplied by 100.

Risk Classification Rules:

1. DTI Ratio 28% or less: LOW RISK - Action: APPROVE
   Housing expense ratio within optimal range. Strong capacity for mortgage payments.

2. DTI Ratio 28.01% to 36%: LOW RISK - Action: APPROVE
   Total DTI within acceptable range. Standard approval pathway.

3. DTI Ratio 36.01% to 43%: MEDIUM RISK - Action: REVIEW
   Elevated DTI. Requires compensating factors such as high credit score (>720), substantial reserves (6+ months), or stable employment history (5+ years).

4. DTI Ratio 43.01% to 50%: HIGH RISK - Action: ESCALATE
   High DTI. Requires exception approval from credit committee. Must document strong compensating factors.

5. DTI Ratio above 50%: CRITICAL RISK - Action: DENY
   DTI exceeds maximum threshold. Application should be declined.

Calculation Method: (Total Monthly Debt Payments / Gross Monthly Income) × 100
Regulatory Reference: Qualified Mortgage Rule (QM)

title: Loan-to-Value Ratio Guidelines
description: Defines LTV thresholds and corresponding requirements
content:
Loan-to-Value Ratio Guidelines Policy

This policy defines LTV thresholds and corresponding requirements for mortgage loans. LTV is calculated as Loan Amount divided by Property Value multiplied by 100.

Risk Classification Rules:

1. LTV Ratio 80% or less: LOW RISK - Action: APPROVE
   Standard LTV. No PMI required. Favorable terms available.

2. LTV Ratio 80.01% to 90%: MEDIUM RISK - Action: APPROVE WITH CONDITIONS
   Elevated LTV. Private Mortgage Insurance (PMI) required. Minimum credit score of 680.

3. LTV Ratio 90.01% to 95%: HIGH RISK - Action: REVIEW
   High LTV. PMI required. Minimum credit score of 720. Maximum DTI of 41%. Requires senior underwriter approval.

4. LTV Ratio 95.01% to 97%: HIGH RISK - Action: ESCALATE
   Very high LTV. Only available for first-time homebuyers. Credit score minimum 740. Requires credit committee approval.

5. LTV Ratio above 97%: CRITICAL RISK - Action: DENY
   LTV exceeds maximum allowable threshold. Consider FHA or VA loan programs if eligible.

Calculation Method: (Loan Amount / Property Value) × 100

title: Employment History Requirements
description: Evaluates employment stability as a credit risk factor
content:
Employment History Requirements Policy

This policy evaluates employment stability as a credit risk factor for mortgage loan applications.

Risk Classification Rules:

1. Full-time employment for 5+ years: LOW RISK - Action: APPROVE
   Strong employment stability. Positive factor for loan approval.

2. Full-time employment for 2-5 years: LOW RISK - Action: APPROVE
   Adequate employment history. Standard verification required.

3. Full-time employment for 1-2 years: MEDIUM RISK - Action: REVIEW
   Limited employment history. Require previous employer verification. Consider industry stability.

4. Full-time employment less than 1 year OR Part-time: HIGH RISK - Action: ESCALATE
   Insufficient employment history or part-time status. Requires additional income documentation and credit committee review.

5. Self-employed: MEDIUM RISK - Action: REVIEW
   Self-employed applicants require 2 years of tax returns, profit/loss statements, and business verification.

6. Unemployed: CRITICAL RISK - Action: DENY
   No current employment. Application should be declined unless substantial passive income or assets exist.

No current employment. Application should be declined unless substantial passive income or assets exist.

title: Cash Reserve Requirements
description: Minimum reserve requirements based on loan type and risk factors
content:
Cash Reserve Requirements Policy

This policy establishes minimum cash reserve requirements based on loan type and risk factors. Reserves are calculated as Liquid Assets divided by total monthly payments (mortgage plus debt).

Risk Classification Rules:

1. Reserves 6+ months: LOW RISK - Action: APPROVE
   Strong reserves. Positive compensating factor. Can offset other risk factors.

2. Reserves 3-6 months: LOW RISK - Action: APPROVE
   Adequate reserves for standard conventional loans.

3. Reserves 2-3 months: MEDIUM RISK - Action: REVIEW
   Minimum reserves. Acceptable for primary residence with strong credit profile.

4. Reserves less than 2 months: HIGH RISK - Action: ESCALATE
   Insufficient reserves. Requires compensating factors such as gift funds documentation or salary increase letter.

Note: 12+ months of reserves is a strong compensating factor that can offset other moderate risk factors.

Calculation Method: Liquid Assets / (Monthly Mortgage Payment + Monthly Debt Payments)
